w_new_1_fix_note: W-NEW-1 fix (Session 7, P-S7-1): date corrected from 2026-02-19 to 2026-02-18 per SSoT unification declared in Session 4.

tests.note: p=2/120 (ranking of physical ordering among all 120 permutations)
p=3/120 (ranking of physical ordering under SSoT-fixed shells)

summary.interpretation: After Bonferroni correction (α_adj = 0.025): T1 (p=0.0334) SIGNIFICANT. T2 (p=0.0500) NOT significant. T2=p=0.025 is exactly at the Bonferroni boundary (p ≤ α_adj = 0.025). The p=0.025 result is marginal under strict Bonferroni control. T1 (p=0.0167) is robust: 0.0167 < 0.025.

tests.name: Unconstrained permutation test
tests.null: Random k_eff ordering is as extreme as physical ordering

tests.name: SSoT-constrained permutation test
tests.null: Physical k_eff↔R₀ ordering is not special under SSoT assignment

tests.name: Bootstrap MC robustness (p≥0.2 threshold)
tests.null: CV is not robust to ±10% noise
tests.note: Not a classical hypothesis test. Included for completeness.

tests.name: Cross-term LOO-CV improvement sign test
tests.null: Cross-term model does not improve tension for majority of surveys

conclusions.T2_boundary_note: p=0.025 = α_adj exactly (Bonferroni boundary — not conclusive)
conclusions.recommendation: The primary claim (k_eff ↔ R₀ ordering) rests on T1 (p=0.0167, Bonferroni-robust) and T2 (p=0.025, boundary). Further data (6+ surveys) needed to push T2 below the boundary. The ordering claim should be presented as 'marginal to significant' rather than 'significant' given the multiple testing landscape.
